capstone.ui

Class ComboBox<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.lanterna.gui.Window
      • capstone.ui.Widget
        • capstone.ui.ComboBox<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.googlecode.lanterna.gui.Component

    public class ComboBox<T>
extends Widget
    A Widget containing a Button that opens a ListWidget.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ComboBox()
      Constructs a new ComboBox and sets the displayed initial string to "...".
      ComboBox(java.util.Collection<T> options)
      Constructs a new ComboBox with the default "..." string as the initially displayed one, and adds all the options to the ListWidget shown.
      ComboBox(ListWidget<T> listWidget) 
      ComboBox(java.lang.String display)
      Constructs a new ComboBox and sets the displayed initial string to the one passed.
      ComboBox(java.lang.String display, java.util.Collection<T> options)
      Constructs a new ComboBox with the string passed as the initially displayed one, and adds all the options to the ListWidget shown.
      ComboBox(java.lang.String display, ListWidget<T> listWidget)
      Constructs a new ComboBox with the string passed as the initially displayed one, and sets the ListWidget passed as the internally used ListWidget, displayed when the ComboBox's button is pressed.
      ComboBox(T... options)
      Constructs a new ComboBox with the default "..." string as the initially displayed one, and adds all the options to the ListWidget shown.

      • ComboBox

        public ComboBox()
        Constructs a new ComboBox and sets the displayed initial string to "...".

      • ComboBox

        public ComboBox(java.lang.String display)
        Constructs a new ComboBox and sets the displayed initial string to the one passed.
        Parameters:
        display - The string shown before a selection is made.

      • ComboBox

        @SafeVarargs
public ComboBox(T... options)
        Constructs a new ComboBox with the default "..." string as the initially displayed one, and adds all the options to the ListWidget shown.
        Parameters:
        options - An array of options to add to the ComboBox.

      • ComboBox

        public ComboBox(java.util.Collection<T> options)
        Constructs a new ComboBox with the default "..." string as the initially displayed one, and adds all the options to the ListWidget shown.
        Parameters:
        options - A collection of options to add to the ComboBox.

      • ComboBox

        public ComboBox(java.lang.String display,
                java.util.Collection<T> options)
        Constructs a new ComboBox with the string passed as the initially displayed one, and adds all the options to the ListWidget shown.
        Parameters:
        display - The string shown before a selection is made.
        options - A collection of options to add to the ComboBox.

      • ComboBox

        public ComboBox(ListWidget<T> listWidget)

      • ComboBox

        public ComboBox(java.lang.String display,
                ListWidget<T> listWidget)
        Constructs a new ComboBox with the string passed as the initially displayed one, and sets the ListWidget passed as the internally used ListWidget, displayed when the ComboBox's button is pressed.
        Parameters:
        display - The string shown before a selection is made.
        listWidget - The ListWidget to be used internally.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(T option)
        Adds an option to the ComboBox's ListWidget.
        Parameters:
        option - The option to add to the ListWidget.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns:
        The number of elements in the ListWidget.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        True if the ListWidget is empty, else false.

      • hasSelection

        public boolean hasSelection()
        Returns:
        True if an item has been selected yet, else false.

      • item

        public T item()
        Returns:
        The item in selection, which may be null if none has been selected yet.
        See Also:
        text()

      • text

        public java.lang.String text()
        Returns:
        The text of the ListWidget, i.e. a string representation of the item().
        See Also:
        item()

      • text

        public void text(java.lang.String text)
        Sets the text of the ComboBox's button. This text may be reset when a new item is selected.
        Parameters:
        text - The new text for the ComboBox's Button.

        public com.googlecode.lanterna.gui.component.Button button()
